snippet: Do our beloved old neighborhoods lose their cool, or do we?
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Ada Calhoun expresses skepticism about most recent round of complaints that East Village, or even New York City as whole, is dead; suggests common thread is nostalgia for time when those grousing were young and felt like they owned their neighborhood or even the city.
lead_paragraph: Do our beloved old neighborhoods lose their cool, or do we?

headline.print_headline: My City Was Gone. (Or Was It?)
headline.main: My City Was Gone. (Or Was It?)
